DOC.brief_title: Patient Function/Fitness Psychosocial Health Improving Health-Related Quality Life Patients With Stage I-IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine correlation patient-reported health-related quality life ( HRQOL ) outcomes clinical/treatment variable well panel function/fitness psychosocial health assessment non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To investigate panel function/fitness psychosocial health assessment patient 's smoke history/status predictor treatment related toxicity . TERTIARY OBJECTIVES : I . The documentation NSCLC lung population prospective combine others . OUTLINE : Patients schedule surgery , radiation therapy , chemotherapy complete European Organization Research Treatment Cancer ( EORTC ) quality life questionnaire ( QLQ ) -core 30 ( C30 ) QLQ-Lung Cancer 13 ( LC13 ) addition psychosocial health smoking status question baseline 2 week prior start treatment , 5-6 week treatment begin , 5-6 month start treatment . During time point , patient also undergo function/fitness assessment include standard health measurement , short physical performance battery ( SPPB ) , 6 minute walk test ( 6MWT ) , grip strength test . After completion study treatment , patient follow every 3-6 month .
